question:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) One of the worst things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back
(B) One of the enjoyable things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back
model_answer:
Sarcasm is a type of communication that uses words to express the opposite of what is meant.
In this case, the statement "One of the enjoyable things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back" is an example of sarcasm. The speaker is stating that returning items to the store and pushing a trolley full of them around the store is an enjoyable or pleasant activity, which is not true. In reality, it is a tedious and time-consuming task that is not enjoyable for most people.
Therefore, the sarcasm is in the statement "One of the enjoyable things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back."
It is important to note that sarcasm can be difficult to recognize, especially if the speaker's tone and facial expressions do not convey the intended meaning.
options: (A) One of the worst things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back
(B) One of the enjoyable things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back
